sentence1: But I can't forget that when I was no better than a slave in your uncle's household in Barbados, ye used me with a certain kindness.
sentence1_translated: Ariko sinzibagirwa ko igihe nari umugaragu mu rugo rwa nyirarume i Barbados, mwanyitayeho mu buryo burangwa n'ineza.

sentence1: I shall be glad to reach Port Royal.   Captain Blood thrust a parchment under Calverley's bulging eyes.
sentence1_translated: Umutware Blood yashyize igitabo munsi y'amaso ya Calverley.

sentence1: There, not more than three miles away, was land--an uneven wall of vivid green that filled the western horizon.
sentence1_translated: Aho hantu hari ku birometero bitatu gusa, hari ku butaka, hari uruzitiro rw'ibiti by'ubwatsi butoshye butoshye, rwuzuye ikirere cy'iburengerazuba.

sentence1: I am His Majesty's envoy to these barbarous parts, and my Lord Sunderland's near kinsman.
sentence1_translated: Ndi intumwa y'ubwami bwe muri ibyo bice by'abanyamahanga, kandi ndi mwene wabo wa Lorde Sunderland.

sentence1: I owed it to you--or thought I did,  he said.
sentence1_translated: Yavuze ko nari mbikwiye cyangwa ko nari mbikeneye.

sentence1: I should have known better than to come so close to Jamaica by night.
sentence1_translated: Nagombaga kumenya neza ko ntaza hafi ya Jamaïque nijoro.

sentence1: Blood's thoughts were upon this and other things as he lounged there on the day-bed.
sentence1_translated: Ibyo n'ibindi bintu ni byo byagiye bihangayikisha Blood igihe yari aryamye ku buriri bwe.

sentence1: But this ain't England, damme.   Came the roar of a second gun, and a round shot splashed the water less than half a cable's-length astern.
sentence1_translated: Ariko iyi si si yo mu Bwongereza, umujinya, haje urusaku rw'imbunda ya kabiri, maze igitero cy'amasasu kirasa amazi mu gice cy'inyuma cy'umurongo w'umurongo w'intoki.

sentence1: Sure, then, I'll be telling ye.
sentence1_translated: Niba ari uko bimeze, nzakubwira.

sentence1: I was coming out on the Royal Mary....
sentence1_translated: Nari ngiye mu bwato bwa Royal Mary...

sentence1: It's through her that we're in this trap,  Ogle stormed on.
sentence1_translated: Ni ukubera ko ari we watumye tugwa muri uwo mutego, kandi Ogle ni we watumye tugwa muri uwo mutego.

sentence1: She left him, and thereafter with Wolverstone, leaning upon the rail, he watched the approach of that boat, manned by a dozen sailors, and commanded by a scarlet figure seated stiffly in the stern sheets.
sentence1_translated: Yamusigiye, hanyuma na Wolverstone, yishingikirije ku ibaraza, yitegereza uko ubwato bwe bwagendaga, buyobowe n'abasare bagera kuri 12 kandi buyobowe n'umuntu utukura wicaye mu mashini z'inyuma.

sentence1: Your motives were no doubt worthy... your gratitude to him for delivering you from the Spaniards.
sentence1_translated: Nta gushidikanya ko impamvu zawe zari zifite agaciro... ugushimira ko yakurokoye ku Banya Esipanye.

sentence1: Why did ye let Wolverstone and the others go?  he cried, with a touch of bitterness.
sentence1_translated: Kuki mwaretse Wolverstone n'abandi baragenda? " Yaraririye, amuhumuriza cyane.

sentence1: It's that cursed petticoat's making a coward of you.
sentence1_translated: Ni uko iyo myenda yawe y'agahomamunwa iguhindura ikicarubozo.

sentence1: Ah! And what way may that be?
sentence1_translated: Kandi se, ibyo bishobora kuba ari ibihe?

sentence1: Ogle wrenched it free, with an oath.
sentence1_translated: Ogle yarayikubise, maze arahira.

sentence1: I do not grant the King's commission lightly.
sentence1_translated: Nta bwo nshyira mu gaciro ku murimo w'Umwami.

sentence1: He realized that he might have to retreat in a hurry.
sentence1_translated: Yumvise ko agomba kwihutira kwivana.

sentence1: Even now Blood had no eyes for that.

sentence1: And yet he has been what he has been and done what he has done in these last three years,  said she, but she said it sorrowfully now, without any of her earlier scorn.
sentence1_translated: Nyamara, yavuze ko yabaye icyo yari cyo, kandi ko yakoze ibyo yakoze mu myaka itatu ishize, ariko ko yabivuze mu buryo bubabaje, nta cyo yari yarigeze amusuzuguraho.

sentence1: I suppose that is after the fashion of your kind.
sentence1_translated: Ntekereza ko ari uko bimeze ku bantu b'urungano rwanyu.

sentence1: A frown rumpled her brow.

sentence1: She had been observing him with shining eyes, but at sight of his dejected countenance, and the deep frown that scarred his brow, her own expression changed.
sentence1_translated: Yari yaramwitegereje afite amaso agaragaza ko yari afite agahinda, ariko igihe yabonaga ukuntu yari yishwe n'agahinda n'imivumo yari imutwikiriye, we ubwe yarahindutse.

sentence1: Walking leisurely, he skirted the embattled wall, and passed through the great gates into the courtyard.
sentence1_translated: Yagiye mu rugo yihanganye, agana ku rukuta rwari rwarashenywe, maze anyura mu marembo manini ajya mu rugo.

sentence1: Say that I look forward to making his acquaintance there.     CHAPTER XXII.
sentence1_translated: Ngaho mbwira ko ntegerezanyije amatsiko kuzabonana na we.

sentence1: You'll ruffle it to the gallows, no doubt,  he said contemptuously.
sentence1_translated: Nta gushidikanya ko uzaguhambira ku giti, ni ukuvuga ko yavugaga nabi.

sentence1: I believe that it was nothing but the hope of taking and hanging Captain Blood that made my uncle leave his Barbados plantations to accept the deputy-governorship of Jamaica.
sentence1_translated: Nemera ko kuba nta kindi cyari gitumye databuja ava mu mirima ye yo muri Barbados ngo yemere kuba guverineri wungirije wa Jamaica atari ibyiringiro byo gufata no kumanika Kapiteni Blood.

sentence1: How could I in honesty have detained them? It was in the bargain.
sentence1_translated: Ni gute nabashaga kubafata mu budahemuka?

sentence1: Colonel Bishop has been notified of my coming.   The sudden change in Calverley's manner at Lord Julian's mention of his name showed that the notification had been received, and that he had knowledge of it.
sentence1_translated: Colonel Bishop yamenyeshejwe ko naje, kandi kuba Calverley yaragize ihinduka mu myitwarire ye igihe Lord Julian yavugaga izina rye, byerekanaga ko yari yaramaze guhabwa iryo tangazo kandi ko yari abizi.

sentence1: At the head of the companion, Ogle found his progress barred by Blood, who confronted him, a sudden sternness in his face and in every line of him.
sentence1_translated: Agitangira gukorana na we, Ogle yabonye ko Blood yamubuzaga gutera imbere, maze amugirira urugomo mu maso no mu mibiri ye yose.

sentence1: I've been hunting him this year past.
sentence1_translated: Mu mwaka ushize, namuhoragaho.

sentence1: At that moment a lane was opened in the ranks of the men, and through this came Miss Bishop followed by her octoroon woman.
sentence1_translated: Muri icyo gihe, mu bantu harimo umuhanda wabagaho, maze Miss Bishop azaho akurikirwa n'umugore we w'imyaka umunani.

sentence1: They are ships of the Jamaica fleet,  his lordship answered her.
sentence1_translated: Umwami yamushubije ko ari amato y'ingabo za Jamaica.

sentence1: And for what had he placed himself in this position? For the sake of a girl who avoided him so persistently and intentionally that he must assume that she still regarded him with aversion.
sentence1_translated: Kandi ni kuki yari yemeye gushyirwa muri iyo mimerere? Ni ukubera umukobwa wamwirindaga abigiranye ukwihangana n'ubugwari ku buryo yagombaga gutekereza ko yari akimubona afite inzika.

sentence1: You may be right, and you may be wrong.
sentence1_translated: Ushobora kuba ufite impamvu, cyangwa se ukumva ko utari ufite impamvu.

sentence1: You have granted, I am told, the King's commission to this man.  His very tone betrayed the bitterness of his rancour.
sentence1_translated: Nabwiwe ko mwemeye ko uwo mugabo ahabwa inshingano n'Umwami, kandi ko amagambo ye yabaga ashishikaje cyane.

sentence1: She was very white, and she kept her eyes upon her folded hands.
sentence1_translated: Yari umweru cyane, kandi yakomeje guhanga amaso amaboko ye.

sentence1: So they've told you about that!
sentence1_translated: None se ibyo barabibabwiye?

sentence1: She realized that perhaps she had, herself, provoked his anger.
sentence1_translated: Yasanze wenda ari we ubwe watumye arakara.

sentence1: I shall always be grateful.
sentence1_translated: Nzakomeza kubishimira.

sentence1: Not for his niece, not for his daughter, not for his own mother, would he forgo the blood what he thinks due to him.
sentence1_translated: Si ku bw'umwishwa we, si ku bw'umukobwa we, si ku bw'umubyeyi we, ntiyari kwemera amaraso, ibyo atekereza ko ari byo byamubereye.

sentence1: Abeam with the Arabella, across the harbour, were the flat-fronted white buildings of that imposing city that came down to the very water's edge.
sentence1_translated: Hakurya y'ikibuga hari inyubako zera z'uwo mugi wari ukomeye cyane, zari zifite imbaho z'amabuye y'agaciro, zigeze ku nkombe z'amazi.

sentence1: In my own I've done nothing at all that I am ashamed of, considering the provocation I received.   Her glance faltered, and fell away before his own that was so intent.
sentence1_translated: Mu byanjye nta kintu na kimwe nakoze na mba kimutera isoni, bitewe n'uko ari bwo nagize icyo mpindura.

sentence1: And maybe it won't.  Slow and mocking came Wolverstone's voice to answer the other's confident excitement, and as he spoke he advanced to Blood's side, an unexpected ally.
sentence1_translated: Mu gihe uwo mugabo yari arimo avuga, yahise ajya ku ruhande rwa Blood, wari incuti itari yitezwe.

sentence1: You were just an unfortunate gentleman then.
sentence1_translated: Icyo gihe wari umugabo w'umugome.

sentence1: Captain Blood bared his head and bowed silently in a greeting which she returned composedly and formally.

sentence1: There had been trouble with Bishop from the moment of landing.
sentence1_translated: Hari ibibazo Bishop yari afite kuva igihe yahageraga.

sentence1: Meanwhile Ogle was growing impatient.
sentence1_translated: Hagati aho, Ogle yari atangiye kumva atishimiye.

sentence1: Lord Julian was sententious, as I gather that he often was.
sentence1_translated: Lord Julian yari umuntu w'umunyacyaha, nk'uko mbibona.

sentence1: Aye--a deal of lies, devil a doubt, as I could prove to you.
sentence1_translated: Ni ukuri, ni ibinyoma byinshi, kandi rwose sinshidikanya ko nabigeraho.

sentence1: But I was in haste to land you.

sentence1: You should have seen the danger.

sentence1: I realize fully what you did, and I realize that partly, at least, you may have been urged by consideration for myself.

sentence1: I'll not be detaining you any longer, ma'am.
sentence1_translated: Sinzongera kugukomeza, madamu.

sentence1: It's our only chance....   The rest of his words were drowned in the shouts of the hands insisting that the girl be given up to be held as a hostage.
sentence1_translated: Ni bwo buryo bwonyine dufite... amagambo ye yose yasigaye yishwe n'amajwi y'amaboko asakuza asaba ko umukobwa yahabwa ngo agirwe imbohe.

sentence1: That is not in the bargain.
sentence1_translated: Ibyo si byo twari twasezeranye.

sentence1: He observed her pale and tense, with parted lips and startled eyes that were fixed upon him, an anxious witness of this deciding of her fate.
sentence1_translated: Yarebye ukuntu yari amuhangayitse kandi ari umunebwe, amureba afite iminwa y'urushundura, kandi amwifuza cyane.

sentence1: And she shivered at the memory of it.
sentence1_translated: Kandi yabyibutse cyane.

sentence1: Aye!  roared in chorus the buccaneers below, and one or two of them elaborated that affirmation.

sentence1: In the cabin he flung into a chair, and exploded, with a violence altogether foreign to his nature.
sentence1_translated: Mu nzu y'imbohe, yaguye mu ntebe, maze aturika, akoresheje urugomo rutari urw'umuntu.

sentence1: I killed him, it is true.

sentence1: So I heard,  she admitted in a small voice.

sentence1_translated: Sinari narigeze ndota...

sentence1: In his cabin on the starboard side Lord Julian, disturbed by the same sounds, was already astir and hurriedly dressing.

sentence1: Blood leaned over the rail to speak to the fair young man immediately below him by the helmsman at the whipstaff.

sentence1: The country is all, sir; the sovereign naught.

sentence1: It gives him a grievance at last.

sentence1: Though we had a cargo of Bishop's nieces it wouldn't make him hold his hand.

sentence1: He was moved to raise his voice above its usual languid level.

sentence1: My name is Wade--Lord Julian Wade.
sentence1_translated: Nitwa Wade, ni Umwami Julian Wade.

sentence1: I see, sir, that you do not yet quite apprehend the circumstances.

sentence1: I am pressed,  she informed him.

sentence1: As for me,  said Lord Julian, with intent to make Miss Bishop's departure free from all interference on the part of the buccaneers,  I shall remain aboard the Arabella until we reach Port Royal.

sentence1: Then:   You ordered it?  he said in accents of unbelief, whilst Lord Julian raised his eyebrows.

sentence1: Expressly.   His lordship waited a moment for a reply.
sentence1_translated: Mu buryo bweruye, Umwami wacu yategereje igisubizo.

sentence1: You know, Peter, that it is Lord Julian alone has stood between Bishop and his hate of you.
sentence1_translated: Uzi ko Lord Julian wenyine ari we wari hagati ya Bishop n'urwango yakwangaga.

sentence1: But many could not resolve one way or the other until they were satisfied upon several questions, and chiefly upon one which was voiced by Ogle.
sentence1_translated: Ariko benshi ntibashoboye gukemura ikibazo kimwe cyangwa ikindi kugeza igihe bahawe ibisubizo ku bibazo byinshi, cyane cyane ku kibazo kimwe cyavuzwe na Ogle.

sentence1: Ye're going to deliver yourself into Bishop's hands,  Pitt warned him.
sentence1_translated: Pitt yamubwiye ko uzashyikirizwa Bishop.

sentence1: Standing beside Captain Blood, he looked astern, following the indication of the Captain's hand, and cried out in his amazement.
sentence1_translated: Yagiye kureba inyuma, ahagaze iruhande rwa Capitaine Blood, akurikije ikiganza cya Capitaine, maze ararira ashimishijwe.

sentence1: He may be right, and he may be wrong.
sentence1_translated: Ashobora kuba ari we ufite ukuri, cyangwa se akaba ari we ufite amakosa.

sentence1: But if she resented his tone and his words, she stifled her resentment.
sentence1_translated: Ariko iyo yabaga ashidikanya ku magambo ye, yabaga amuhemukiye.

sentence1: I am informed that yesterday evening a frigate left the harbour having on board your associate Wolverstone and a hundred men of the hundred and fifty that were serving under you.

sentence1: And instantly would have recalled the words had she been able.

sentence1: But that it was no more than a mask for his fury and his venom was plain to all.

sentence1: Levasseur?  He smiled a little.
sentence1_translated: Levasseur yarasetse cyane.

sentence1: HOSTILITIES   In the great harbour of Port Royal, spacious enough to have given moorings to all the ships of all the navies of the world, the Arabella rode at anchor.
sentence1_translated: Mu cyambu kinini cya Port Royal, cyari kinini bihagije ku buryo cyashoboraga gushyikira amato yose yo mu ngabo z'intambara zo ku isi, icyo kiyaga cya Arabella cyasimbutse.

sentence1: He swung to Lord Julian.
sentence1_translated: Yagiye kureba Lord Julian.

sentence1: Good-morning to you,  he said, and added  I've blundered badly, so I have.
sentence1_translated: Yaramubwiye ati "mugire umunsi mwiza", yongeraho ko nakoze ikosa rikomeye, kandi rwose narakoze.

sentence1: He stepped back, a baffled, impotent man.
sentence1_translated: Yagiye inyuma, ari umuntu utumva neza kandi udashobora gukora icyo ashaka.

sentence1: Although even some o' they should know better, for there's still a few was on Barbados with us, and are acquainted like me and you with Colonel Bishop.
sentence1_translated: Nubwo hari n'abafite ubumenyi, hari n'abafite ubumenyi ku birebana na Col. Bishop.

sentence1: Pitt, loosely clad in shirt and breeches, leaned against the rail the while and watched him, unmistakable concern imprinted on his fair, frank countenance.
sentence1_translated: Pitt, wari wambaye umwenda n'imyenda, yarahagaze ku muhanda maze amwitegereza, afite impungenge zitumvikanaga zanditswe mu maso ye meza kandi yeruye.

sentence1: That'll be the signal to lie to,  said Blood, in the same listless voice; and he fetched a sigh.
sentence1_translated: Uwo ni ikimenyetso cyo kubeshya, Blood yavuze, mu ijwi rimwe nta bwikunde; kandi yahumutse.

sentence1: And what better are these?--Are ye afeard of a lubberly Barbados planter? Whatever ails you, Peter? I've never known ye scared afore.   A gun boomed out behind them.
sentence1_translated: Kandi iki cyiza ibi? - Ese utinya umusaruro w'ibishyimbo bya Barbados? icyo ari cyo cyose kiguhangayikishije, Peter? Sinigeze menya ko watinya mbere. imbunda yabarashe inyuma.

sentence1: And a couple of miles this side of it, bearing after them, came speeding three great white ships.
sentence1_translated: Kandi ku birometero bike, ubwato butatu bw'umweru bwari bugiye kubakurikira.

sentence1: It's our only chance, I've said, and we must take it.   The better way that was in Captain Blood's mind was the way that already he had proposed to Wolverstone.

sentence1: The young master's grey eyes skimmed it.
sentence1_translated: Amaso y'umwigisha wari ukiri muto yari yarahindutse.

sentence1: Whether the men in the panic Ogle had aroused among them would take a different view from Wolverstone's he did not know.

sentence1: Heave her to, and signal to them to send a boat.   A silence of astonishment fell upon the ship--of astonishment and suspicion at this sudden yielding.
sentence1_translated: Mujye muhamagarana, mubategeke kohereza ubwato, maze ubwato bubure amahwemo, mujye muhumeka kandi mutekereze ko mugiye kugwa mu kaga.

sentence1: I accept it as the only way to save us all from the certain destruction into which my own act may have brought us.

sentence1: I... I can't think why you should speak to me like this,  she said, with less than her earlier assurance.
sentence1_translated: Sinzi impamvu wagombye kumvugisha utyo, yavuze ko nta cyo yari amubwiye mbere.

sentence1: And the quixotic fool is running into danger at the present moment on our behalf.

sentence1: Ye'll remember afterwards that it was your hardness drove me.   She moved to depart, then checked, and faced him again.

sentence1: Linked to Nova Scotia by the narrow Chignecto Isthmus, New Brunswick became a separate province in 1784 at the demand of 14,000 Loyalist refugees.
sentence1_translated: Kubera ko New Brunswick yari ifitanye isano na Nova Scotia ikoresheje icyambu cya Chignecto, yabaye intara yihariye mu mwaka wa 1784, bitewe n'uko impunzi z'Abanyeshyanga 14,000 zari zisabye ko iyo ntara iba iy'ubundi bwoko.

sentence1: The largest bay on the northwest coast makes a fine harbor, but both the water and the beach can be dirty.

sentence1: Those skyscrapers are banks, and the street on which they stand has been nicknamed the Milla de Oro, or Golden Mile.
sentence1_translated: Izo nkuta z'ijuru ni amabanki, kandi umuhanda zihagarariye witwa Milla de Oro, cyangwa Mile ya Zahabu.

sentence1: Children will enjoy the Cite de la Mer (37 Rue de l'Asile Thomas), with exhibits on the history of boatbuilding, the fishing industry, and how tides and currents shape the coastline.
sentence1_translated: Abana bazishimira Cite de la Mer (mu muhanda wa 37 Rue de l'Asile Thomas), aho bazajya babona ibyerekanwa ku mateka y'ubwubatsi bw'amato, iby'uburobyi n'ukuntu imigezi n'imigezi byashushanyaga inyanja.

sentence1: Natural enough, then, that involvement in World War II began with a British Commonwealth Air Training Plan, using Canada's safer skies to prepare pilots for combat.
sentence1_translated: Ku bw'ibyo, birumvikana ko iyo ntambara yatangiye igihe habaga hari gahunda yo gutoza abagenzi mu kirere bo mu muryango w'ibihugu by'u Bwongereza, bakoresheje ikirere cyiza cyo muri Kanada kugira ngo bategure abapayilote kujya mu ntambara.

sentence1: The Ming Tombs were once a staple of tours to the Great Wall at Badaling, but foreign tourists have seldom been impressed by the site, finding it dank and poorly restored.
sentence1_translated: Imva za Ming zari intangiriro y'urugendo rwo gusura Urukuta rukomeye rw'i Badaling, ariko abagenzi bo mu mahanga ntibakunze guterwa ishema n'aho hantu, kuko hari ahantu h'ubushyuhe kandi hari kubakwa neza.

sentence1: The best ports in the Mediterranean are June, July, August, and Mae,  said the 16th-century Venetian admiral Andrea Doria, noting that beyond the summer sailing season, a fleet couldn't do better than shelter here.
sentence1_translated: Amakivuko meza cyane yo mu nyanja ya Mediterane ni muri Kamena, Nyakanga, Kanama, na Mae, nk'uko byatangajwe n'umukuru w'ingabo z'u Bwenesi mu kinyejana cya 16, ari we Andrea Doria, avuga ko mu gihe cy'imvura yo mu mpeshyi, ubwato bw'intambara bwagombaga kubukorera aho hantu.

sentence1: Among the 27 hiking trails the best are the Glasgow Lakes trail to John Deer Lake and the trail around Beulach Ban Falls and French Mountain.
sentence1_translated: Mu nzira 27 z'urugendo, zimwe mu nziza ni iz'i Glasgow Lakes zigana ku kiyaga cya John Deer, n'iz'i Beulach Ban Falls n'iz'i French Mountain.

sentence1: And they remain tolerant and helpful, even though they know that their lovely coast is no longer just theirs.
sentence1_translated: Kandi bakomeza kwihanganira abandi no kubafasha, nubwo bazi ko ubutaka bwabo bwiza butacyari ubwabo gusa.

sentence1: Kublai Khan erected his own capital in 1279 on the shores of Beijing's Beihai Lake, where some of his imperial treasures remain on display today.
sentence1_translated: Kublai Khan yubatse umurwa mukuru we mu mwaka wa 1279 ku nkombe z'ikiyaga cya Beihai i Beijing, aho hari ubutunzi bw'ubwami bwe bugikomeje kuboneka muri iki gihe.

sentence1: The roadless Na Pali Coast on the heavenly north shore is one of the world's most challenging and majestic seaside hikes (see page 71).
sentence1_translated: Inyanja ya Na Pali itagira imihanda iri ku nkombe yo mu majyaruguru y'ijuru, ni imwe mu ngendo zo ku nkombe z'inyanja ziteye ubwoba kandi z'akataraboneka kurusha izindi ku isi (reba ku ipaji ya 71).

sentence1: Assimilating more easily with the Anglo community only Protestant schools accepted their children Eastern European Jews have  graduated  to wealthy Westmount or emigrated, again, to Toronto.

sentence1: If possible, familiarize yourself with the plot in advance.

sentence1: Napoleon attacked and destroyed Catalonia's sacred shrine, the monastery at Montserrat.

sentence1: With its entry into the Common Market in 1981, Greece's economic prospects strengthened.

sentence1: Sea temperatures vary between 18e and 24e C (64-75e F).
sentence1_translated: Ubushyuhe bw'inyanja bugenda buva kuri 18°C kugeza kuri 24°C (64-75°F).

sentence1: The Kinabalu national park is just one of six protected regions in the state.

sentence1: The Poble Espanyol (Spanish Village), on Montjuac's northeastern flank, is an attraction for which the cliche  fun for the whole family  might have been invented.
sentence1_translated: Poble Espanyol (Umudugudu w'Abesipanyoli) uri ku ruhande rw'amajyaruguru ashyira uburasirazuba bwa Montjuac, ni ahantu h'ibyishimo abantu bose bashobora kuba barishimiraga.

sentence1: Today the old building hosts the Edinburgh Experience, a 20-minute, 3-D slide show charting the history of the city and bringing to life the Edinburgh of today (April-October only).
sentence1_translated: Muri iki gihe, iyo nzu ya kera irimo Edinburgh Experience, ikaba ari ikiganiro cy'iminota 20 cy'amashusho y'amayerekero mu byiciro 3 agaragaza amateka y'umujyi kandi agatanga ubuzima bwa Edimburgo yo muri iki gihe (kuva muri Mata kugeza mu Ukwakira gusa).

sentence1: Dora Stratou Folk Dance Theater presents performances of traditional Greek song, dance, and music at a traditional  folk-village -type auditorium on Philopappos Hill from May to September daily except Mondays.
sentence1_translated: Dora Stratou Folk Dance Theatre igaragaza imibonano y'indirimbo gakondo y'Ikigiriki, kubyina, n'umuziki mu nzu ndangamurage isanzwe yo mu mudugudu wa Philopappos Hill kuva muri Gicurasi kugeza muri Nzeri buri munsi uretse kuwa mbere.

sentence1: You'll see videos of Anne's story and of Amsterdam under occupation along with photographs and artifacts of the time.
sentence1_translated: Uzabona videwo z'inkuru ya Anne n'iz'i Amsterdam yari ikiriho, hamwe n'amafoto n'ibishushanyo byo muri icyo gihe.

sentence1: Beside it, the Norman Gothic La Martorana church, partly remodeled with a Baroque faaade and porch, has a fine campanile with four storys of slender mullioned windows.
sentence1_translated: Uretse iyo nzu, hari urusengero rwa La Martorana rwo mu bwoko bw'Abagoteki bo mu gihe cya Norman, rwari rwarasenywe mu buryo bwa giseseka n'urw'inyuma y'inzu y'icumbi, rwari rufite inzu y'ishusho nziza y'icyuma cy'amabati, ifite ibyumba bine by'amadirishya y'amabarabara.

sentence1: The lake itself lies in the shadow of several high mountains, including Scafell Pike, the highest in England at 977 m (3,205 ft).
sentence1_translated: Iki kiyaga ubwabyo kiri mu gicucu cy'imisozi miremire myinshi, harimo na Scafell Pike, iri hejuru mu Bwongereza ku metero 977 (3,205 ft).

sentence1: This collection of European and Puerto Rican art, probably the finest in the Caribbean, would be very much at home in any European capital.
sentence1_translated: Iyi nzu y'ubuhanzi y'i Burayi n'i Porto Rico, ishobora kuba ari yo nziza cyane mu karere ka Karayibe, ishobora kuba ahantu hameze neza mu murwa mukuru uwo ari wo wose w'i Burayi.

sentence1: Treasure Beach is the only resort area to speak of, with just a handful of hotels stretching across three sandy bays.
sentence1_translated: Ikirwa cya Treasure Beach ni cyo gice cyonyine cyo muri icyo gihugu cy'amahoteli, kandi hariho hoteli nke cyane ziganjemo imigezi itatu y'umusenyi.

sentence1: Then comes Bona, a center of basketry which also bills itself as the home of the kecak dance.
sentence1_translated: Hanyuma haje Bona, ikigo cy'ibikapu cyitwaraga nk'aho ari cyo cyibereye inzu yo kubyina muri kecak.

sentence1: If you're feeling up to it, push on along the Mist Trail, past Emerald Pool, to Nevada Fall, and you'll begin to lose the crowds.
sentence1_translated: Niba wumva ko ushobora kubikora, komeza kunyura ku nzira y'icuraburindi, ujye kure ya Emerald Pool, ugere muri Nevada Fall, maze ujye utangira gutakaza imbaga y'abantu.

sentence1: Summer brings warm (but not hot) weather and warm sea temperatures, making it ideal for diving, snorkeling, and other water sports.
sentence1_translated: Mu mpeshyi haba hari ikirere cyiza (ariko si icyihebuje) n'ubushyuhe bw'inyanja, bityo kikaba ari ahantu heza ho koga, kurohama mu mazi no mu bindi bikorwa by'imikino yo mu mazi.

sentence1: Among the ponds is one inhabited by  Visitors toss in coins in the hope of bouncing one off a turtle's head, a sure way of achieving good fortune.
sentence1_translated: Mu birombe harimo kimwe cy'abantu batembereza amafaranga, bafite icyizere ko bazabasha kugikubita ku mutwe w'igishondabagabo, bityo bakaba bashobora kugira amahirwe.

sentence1: Among the many jazz clubs are the famed Jazz Bakery in Culver City, the Catalina Bar and Grill in Hollywood, and the Baked Potato in North Hollywood.
sentence1_translated: Mu makipe menshi ya Jazz harimo icyumba kizwi cyane cyitwa Jazz Bakery kiri i Culver City, Catalina Bar and Grill iri i Hollywood, na Baked Potato iri muri North Hollywood.

sentence1: At the center of the resort, in the sheltered waters of the inner lagoon, there is a  Swim with the Dolphins  program.
sentence1_translated: Mu gace k'ikigo cy'ubushakashatsi, mu mazi y'ikiyaga cyo mu nyanja, hari gahunda yo koga n'udufi.

sentence1: The port town of Nafplio makes the perfect base for touring the area, or perhaps a spot to have lunch while on your tour.
sentence1_translated: Umujyi wa Nafplio uri ku cyambu, ni wo uba ahantu heza ho gutembera muri ako gace, cyangwa se ukaba ahantu ho gusangira n'abandi mu gihe uri ku rugendo.

sentence1: Some of its residents are descendants of the valiant laborers who helped build the Canadian Pacific Railway.
sentence1_translated: Bamwe mu baturage baho bakomoka ku bakozi b'intwari bafashije mu kubaka gari ya moshi ya Kanada ya Pasifika.

sentence1: Get off at the stop before Batthyany ter to admire the colourful exterior of the 1896 Neo-Gothic Calvinist Church which features in so many panoramas of the city.
sentence1_translated: Mujye muhagarara imbere ya Batthyany ter maze mujye mubona amabara menshi y'itorero rya Calviniste rya Neo-Gothic ryo mu mwaka wa 1896, rigaragaza ibintu byinshi biranga umujyi.

sentence1: It was here in 1775 that 100 barrels of gunpowder mysteriously disappeared from stores in Fort St. Catherine and found their way onto a boat bound for the use of the American revolutionaries.
sentence1_translated: Aha ni ho mu mwaka wa 1775 barihishaga amasasu 100 y'imbunda mu buryo bw'amayobera, ava mu bubiko bwo mu kigo cya Fort St. Catherine, maze agera ku bwato bwari bugiye gukoreshwa n'abahinduzi b'Abanyamerika.

sentence1: Others well worth visiting include the home of Balzac (47 Rue Rayanouard) and Delacroix's studio (6 Rue de Furstenberg).
sentence1_translated: Mu bindi bintu byiza wagombye gusura harimo inzu ya Balzac (mu muhanda wa 47 Rayanouard) n'inzu Delacroix yakoreragamo imirimo (mu muhanda wa 6 Furstenberg).

sentence1: In Prinsengracht, Otto Frank and his family hid in the attic of their business premises for over two years before being discovered.
sentence1_translated: Otto Frank n'umuryango we bamaze imyaka isaga ibiri bihishe mu igorofa ry'inzu yabo y'ubucuruzi, mbere y'uko babimenya.

sentence1: If you've become an adept of the tea ceremony, you'll appreciate the excellent collection of 14th-century  ceramic tea bowls, tea kettles, and caddies, as well as bamboo spoons, whisks, and flower vases.
sentence1_translated: Niba uzi neza ibirori byo gusangira icyayi, ushobora gushimira ku byo ubona mu matungo y'ibikombe by'icyayi, mu macupa y'icyayi n'ibindi bicupa by'ibiti by'ibiti byo mu kinyejana cya 14, hamwe n'ibikombe by'ibishyimbo, amacupa y'amavuta y'icyatsi n'ibishyimbo by'indabo.

sentence1: The showpieces are the new lion exhibit, snow leopard and cheetah exhibits, and an African tropical rain forest, which is complete with gorillas and warthogs.
sentence1_translated: Muri ibyo bintu by'ingenzi, harimo igishushanyo cy'intare nshya, inyamaswa z'inkazi n'iz'ibishushanyo by'inyoni z'urubura, n'ishyamba ry'imvura y'ibihebuje ryo muri Afurika, rifite ibinyugunyugu n'ibinyugunyugu.

sentence1: Even the location of the building is a technological marvel.
sentence1_translated: Ndetse n'aho iyo nzu iri ni igitangaza mu by'ikoranabuhanga.

sentence1: In fact, it was the flashpoint for protests and riots during the busing controversy in the 1970s.
sentence1_translated: Mu by'ukuri, ni cyo cyari intandaro y'imyivumbagatanyo n'imyivumbagatanyo mu myaka ya za 70.

sentence1: Famous for its August log-rolling contests, the town of Squamish makes a useful base for hiking tours into Garibaldi Provincial Park.
sentence1_translated: Umugi wa Squamish uzwi cyane kubera amarushanwa yo gutwara ibiti mu kwezi k'Ugushyingo, ni ahantu ho gutembera mu busitani bwa Garibaldi.

sentence1: For an authentic feel of old Portugal, slip into the cool entrance hall of theimpressive Leal Senado ( Loyal Senate  building), a fine example of colonial architecture.
sentence1_translated: Kugira ngo umenye neza Igiporutugali cya kera, kanda mu cyumba cy'inyuma cy'inzu y'ikirenga y'umugi wa Leal Senado (inyubako y'Inama Nkuru y'Abanyamahanga), urugero rwiza rw'ubwubatsi bw'abakoloni.

sentence1: (The event is repeated on 14-15 August. )
sentence1_translated: (Iki gikorwa cyongeye gusubirwamo ku itariki ya 14-15 Kanama.)

sentence1: Dominating the mouth of Sant Antoni Bay is the gaunt silhouette of the island of Coniera, or Conejera (meaning  rabbit's warren  or  burrow ).
sentence1_translated: Mu kanwa k'ikigobe cya Sant Antoni, hari isura y'igisozi cya Coniera cyangwa Conejera (bisobanura "ikigobe cy'impanga").

sentence1: These link the main public beaches (from Warwick Long Bay to Horseshoe Bay).

sentence1: It was they who made the first and hardiest effort to hew a modern living out of this hard land.

sentence1: Built in a.d. 688-691, it is decorated in thousands of exquisite, predominantly blue and yellow, Persian ceramic tiles, with Koranic scriptures on the lintels.

sentence1: Notice how the trompe l'oeil painting on the low arched ceiling aspires to turn the little church into a lofty Gothic cathedral.

sentence1: Only hikes accompanied by guides from the local guiding cooperative are advised.

sentence1: At the moment, the thinking is that it's perhaps best to leave these smaller, less developed islands in peace.

sentence1: One inmate returning for the guided tour surprisingly, some do, out of nostalgia said the food was better than he had eaten in many San Francisco hotels.

sentence1: Even in these early times the gods would be consulted with the oracle issuing their verdicts from the Rock of Sybil.

sentence1: The Baixada de Santa Eulalia descends to carrer dels Banys Nous, named for the long-gone  new  baths of the ghetto erected in the 12th century.

sentence1: Once you're off the traffic-squeezed main arteries, you'll find that Albufeira's old town preserves a surprising bit of traditional charm.

sentence1: Close to the original action and still providing the most vivid testimony to the Klondike days, the boomtown of Dawson City yielded in 1951 to the transportation and communications center of Whitehorse as territorial capital.
sentence1_translated: Mu gihe cy'imyaka myinshi, umujyi wa Dawson City wari hafi y'ibikorwa bya mbere kandi ukaba ukomeje gutanga ubuhamya burangwa n'ishyaka ku gihe cya Klondike, mu mwaka wa 1951 waremeye ko umujyi wa Whitehorse uba umurwa mukuru w'akarere.

sentence1: This was the island bought by Errol Flynn when he settled in Port Antonio in 1946
sentence1_translated: Icyo kirwa ni cyo Errol Flynn yaguze igihe yabaga i Port Antonio mu mwaka wa 1946

sentence1: Cala Mondrage is practically undeveloped (by the standards of coastal Mallorca), and may stay that way by order of the regional government, which has become alarmed by the specter of unchecked building along the coast.
sentence1_translated: Cala Mondrage ntiyari yarabayeho mu buryo bw'ukuri (ku rugero rw'inkengero za Mallorca), kandi ishobora kugumaho mu buryo nk'ubwo ku bw'itegeko rya guverinoma y'akarere, yatangarijwe n'ubwubatsi butarimo gutegekwa ku nkombe.

sentence1: It has three meru-topped shrines dedicated to Brahma, Shiva, and Vishnu.
sentence1_translated: Hari insengero eshatu z'ikirenga z'urwibutso rwari rwarashyizweho mu rwego rwo gusenga Brahma, Shiva na Vishnu.

sentence1: Less than a mile past the Arboretum, you will find two churches on the right side of the road, backed by hundreds of white painted family tombs on the hillside.

sentence1: The Stampede was originally conceived to show all the techniques and excitement of rounding up cattle on the prairies.
sentence1_translated: Mu mizo ya mbere, iyo Stampede yagenewe kugaragaza uburyo bwo guteranya inka mu mirima.

sentence1: Almost 100,000 people a day come here to marvel at the striking architecture and explore the latest attractions in this ever-changing city.

sentence1: The Beaux Arts City Hall has been replaced by nearby Government Center.

sentence1: Behind the hotel, beyond an 1898 statue of Samuel de Champlain, the city's founder, Dufferin Terrace offers a magnificent view over the St. Lawrence and downriver to the Ile d'Orleans.
sentence1_translated: Nyuma y'iyo hoteli, hari ikindi gishushanyo cya Samuel de Champlain washinze uwo mugi mu mwaka wa 1898, Dufferin Terrace ifite ahantu heza cyane hahanze umugezi wa St. Lawrence, hagana ku ruzi rwa Ile d'Orleans.

sentence1: Beyond Payangan, the little-used road wends its way through scenic countryside all the way to Batur (see pagea59).

sentence1: The Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), founded in 1861 is America's leading science and engineering establishment that has pioneered many modern technologies, from stroboscopic photography to food preservation processes.
sentence1_translated: Ikigo cya Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), cyashinzwe mu mwaka wa 1861, ni cyo kigo cy'ingenzi mu bya siyansi n'ubuhanga muri Amerika, kikaba cyarateye imbere mu ikoranabuhanga rya none, kuva mu ifoto y'amabara y'ibinyabuzima kugeza mu bikorwa byo kubika ibyokurya.

sentence1: Six kilometers (4 miles) north of Ipoh is the Perak Tong, built in 1926 by a Buddhist priest from China.

sentence1: Kodaly kerend (Kodaly crescent, named after another Hungarian composer) is a splendid ensemble, its curving faaades decorated with Classical  gures and inlaid motifs.

sentence1: Plans to house parliament here after Independence came to nothing

sentence1: The 60-year rule of Ramses II (1279-1212 b.c. ) was a great finale to the New Kingdom era.

sentence1: An entrance tunnel with a kitchen alcove on one side, and storage alcoves on the other, leads to the main living area.

sentence1: The Liao capital at Beijing, then known as Yanjing, occupied the southeast region of what is the modern capital today, with the Fayuan Temple the only surviving monument.

sentence1: You can walk the decks or even take a two-hour cruise on this replica of the famous 1921 champion sailship portrayed on the Canadian ten-cent coin.

sentence1: Visitors to the Spectrum section are encouraged to manipulate various machines and participate in scientific experiments.

sentence1: In past centuries, however, it was the haunt of Caribbean pirates, being far from the clutches of colonial overlords in Havana, San Juan in Puerto Rico, and Panama City, the nearest colonial outposts.

sentence1: Tourist offices have tried to rename the area L'Estrie, but even the most militant Quebecois prefer the customary direct, if approximate, translation of the  Cantons de l'Est.

sentence1: On your way, you'll pass the Palace of Fine Arts, a restored relic of the Panama-Pacific International Exposition.

sentence1: The corner house at Number 8 was until recently the official residence of the president of the Generalitat.

sentence1: After two centuries of religious heresy, the Church needed a spiritual renewal, finding the perfect ally in Francis of Assisi (1182-1226), pious without being troublesomely militant.
